main.name: Andrew Palo
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: 3.93 GPA, Business Minor, Summa Cum Laude, Honors Research Distinction

work.title: Patent Engineer
work.description:
- Drafted several patent applications for inventions utilizing groundbreaking technologies in the following fields
	- Semiconductor device structure and fabrication
	Broadband cellular networking
Maximized effectiveness of patent protection by drafting detailed yet broad claims
Conducted effective interviews with USPTO Patent Examiners to expedite application allowance
Prepared several responses to communications received from the USPTO, such as office actions and appeal briefs
Collaborated with in-house patent counsel for Fortune 500 companies, both in the US and abroad
Oversaw firmwide database outlining expected days of work and expected billings to optimize work item allocation 
Strategized and developed several Microsoft Office VBA macros for automating various aspects of patent prosecution

work.title: Junior bug fixer

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
